a.title: Optional, defaults to 'TRANSACTIONAL'
Optional, no default value available
Optional, defaults to 'false'
Optional, defaults to 'false'
Optional, defaults to 'TRANSACTIONAL'
Optional, no default value available
Optional, defaults to 'false'
Optional, defaults to 'false'
Optional, defaults to 'false'
Optional, defaults to '{0}DaoBase'
Optional, defaults to '{0}DaoException'
Optional, defaults to '{0}DaoImpl'
Optional, defaults to 'false'
Optional, defaults to '{0}Dao'
Optional, defaults to 'true'
Optional, no default value available
Optional, no default value available
Optional, defaults to 'NONE'
Optional, defaults to '20'

Optional, defaults to '1'

Optional, defaults to 'TIMESTAMP'
Optional, defaults to 'TYPE'
Optional, defaults to 'STRING'
Optional, defaults to 'true'
Optional, defaults to 'SINGLE_TABLE'
Optional, defaults to 'local'

Optional, no default value available
Optional, no default value available
Optional, no default value available
Optional, defaults to 'java:/DefaultDS'

Optional, no default value available

Optional, defaults to 'javax.jms.Queue'

Optional, defaults to '{0}Impl'

Optional, defaults to '{0}Embeddable'
Optional, defaults to '{0}Impl'
Optional, defaults to '{0}Listener'
Optional, defaults to '{0}'
Optional, defaults to 'handle{0}'
Optional, defaults to '{0}'
Optional, no default value available
Optional, defaults to '{0}Labels'
Optional, defaults to '{0}Label'
Optional, defaults to '{0}CreateManageableException'
Optional, defaults to '{0}DeleteManageableException'
Optional, defaults to '{0}ReadManageableException'
Optional, defaults to '{0}Base'
Optional, defaults to '{0}UpdateManageableException'
Optional, defaults to '{0}SubscriptionId'
Optional, defaults to '{0}MDBBeanImpl'
Optional, defaults to '{0}Listener'
Optional, defaults to '{0}MDBBean'
Optional, defaults to '{0}Test'
Optional, defaults to '{0}.test'
Optional, defaults to '{0}Base'
Optional, defaults to '{0}Delegate'
Optional, defaults to '{0}BeanImpl'
Optional, defaults to '{0}'
Optional, defaults to '{0}Listener'
Optional, defaults to '{0}Local'
Optional, defaults to '{0}Bean'
Optional, defaults to 'test{0}'
Optional, defaults to '{0}Remote'
Optional, defaults to '{0}Test'
Optional, defaults to '{0}.test'
Optional, defaults to '{0}WSInterface'
Optional, defaults to 'true'
Optional, defaults to 'set'
Optional, no default value available
Optional, defaults to 'datatype::String'
Optional, defaults to 'true'
Optional, defaults to 'java.util.Set'
Optional, defaults to 'Hibernate'
Optional, defaults to 'org.andromda.ejb3'
Optional, no default value available

Optional, defaults to 'ManageableServiceLocator'

Optional, defaults to 'false'
Optional, defaults to 'REQUIRED'
Optional, defaults to '{0}'
Optional, defaults to '{0}'
Optional, defaults to 'UTF-8'

div.documentation: Defines the locations to which output is generated.

a.title: Required
Required
Required
Required
Required
Required
Required
Required

Required

Optional, defaults to 'Admin'
Optional, no default value available
Optional, defaults to 'ServiceLocator'

Required
Go to Outlet Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The location to which all service classes (including the service locator(s)) will be generated.

a.title: Go to Outlet Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The directory to which Entity POJOs are generated.

a.title: Go to Outlet Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The location to which Entity POJO implementation files are generated.

a.title: Go to Outlet Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The location where the persistence XML descriptor is generated.

a.title: Go to Outlet Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The directory to which Session Bean files are generated.

a.title: Go to Outlet Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The directory to which Session Bean implementation files are generated.

a.title: Go to Outlet Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The location where the ejb-jar.xml XML descriptor is generated.

a.title: Go to Outlet Properties namespace element group

td.documentation:
The location to which EJB3 DAOs, and any support classes are generated.
Please NOTE that the dao implementation classes will also be generated to this location when no operations are present on the entity with classifier scope.

a.title: Go to Outlet Properties namespace element group

td.documentation:
The location to which EJB3 DAO implementation classes will be generated (if there are any classifier scoped business operations modeled on any entity).
Please NOTE that the dao implementation classes will be generated to the daos outlet when no operations are present on the entity with classifier scope.

a.title: Go to Outlet Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The location where the application specific XML descriptors are generated. i.e the application login-config.xml descriptor.

a.title: Go to Outlet Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The location where the application specific XML descriptors that are packaged in the ear file are generated.

a.title: Go to Outlet Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The directory to which Message Driven Bean files are generated.

a.title: Go to Outlet Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The directory to which Message Driven Bean implementation files are generated.

a.title: Go to Outlet Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The directory to which common classes for session beans, entity POJOs or MDB are generated

a.title: Go to Outlet Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The location to which user-types such as enumeration are generated.

a.title: Go to Outlet Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The location where the JBoss Embedded/Microcontainer configuration files are generated.

a.title: Go to Outlet Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The location where auto generated session bean test classes are generated. These are typically the helper classes which are re-generated.

a.title: Go to Outlet Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The location where manual session bean test classes are generated. These will not be regenerated and require user intervention.

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation: The name assigned to the entity manager. If no name is specified, the name of the containing persistence archive without the .par extension is used.

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation: Specifies the global JNDI name of the JTA data source.

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation:
Automatically export schema DDL to the database when deployed. With create-drop, the database schema will be dropped when the entity is undeployed. Permitted values are:
update
create
create-drop
none

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation:
The SQL dialect of the database.
org.hibernate.dialect.MySQLDialect
org.hibernate.dialect.MySQLInnoDBDialect
org.hibernate.dialect.MySQLMyISAMDialect
org.hibernate.dialect.HSQLDialect
org.hibernate.dialect.PostgreSQLDialect
org.hibernate.dialect.DB2Dialect
org.hibernate.dialect.OracleDialect
org.hibernate.dialect.Oracle9Dialect
org.hibernate.dialect.SybaseDialect
org.hibernate.dialect.SQLServerDialect
org.hibernate.dialect.SAPDBDialect
org.hibernate.dialect.InformixDialect
org.hibernate.dialect.IngresDialect
org.hibernate.dialect.ProgressDialect
org.hibernate.dialect.InterbaseDialect
org.hibernate.dialect.PointbaseDialect
org.hibernate.dialect.FrontbaseDialect
org.hibernate.dialect.FirebirdDialect

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not to log SQL statements.

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation: Sets a maximum "depth" for the outer join fetch tree. Recommended values between 0 and 3

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation: A non-zero value determines the JDBC fetch size

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation: A nonzero value enables use of JDBC2 batch updates by Hibernate. Recommended values between 5 and 30

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not to enable use of JDBC2 scrollable resultsets by Hibernate. This property is only necessary when using user supplied connections. Hibernate uses connection metadata otherwise.

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not to use streams when writing / reading binary or serializable types to/from JDBC.

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation: The comma separated ejb jars that are included in the deployed ear package.

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation: JDBC Driver to make a database connection.

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation: The database user login name.

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation: The database user password.

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation: URL for the JDBC Driver to make the connection to the database.

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation: Full JNDI name of data source to use. (would be used instead of the connection properties, driver, username, password, etc).

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation: The JNDI name of data source to use without prefix like java:/.

a.title: Go to Cache namespace element group

td.documentation:
Defines Hibernate Cache Provider implementation class. Possible values for JBoss4/Hibernate are:
org.hibernate.cache.HashtableCacheProvider
org.jboss.ejb3.entity.TreeCacheProviderHook

a.title: Go to Cache namespace element group

td.documentation:
Defines the Hibernate cache MBean object name used in JBoss4.
jboss.cache:service=EJB3EntityTreeCache

a.title: Go to Cache namespace element group

td.documentation: Enable/disable hibernate's second level cache features for the cartridge. This implies the JBoss Cache framework for the EJB3 cartridge. By enabling this, you are enabling entity caching.

a.title: Go to Cache namespace element group

td.documentation: Enable/disable Hibernate's second level cache feature for entity associations. Please NOTE that hibernateEnableCache should also be enabled when specifying this property.

a.title: Go to Cache namespace element group

td.documentation: Enable/disable Hibernate's query cache feature for queries. Please NOTE that hibernateEnableCache should also be enabled when specifying this property.

a.title: Go to Cache namespace element group

td.documentation: Set to true if you do NOT wish to separate the entity and query cache regions. That way, all entities and queries use the default cache region. Set to false and the cartridge will create a new cache region for all entities and all queries marked as cacheable.

a.title: Go to Cache namespace element group

td.documentation:
Defines the default strategy for Entities caching. Can be overwritten using the corresponding tagged value @andromda.persistence.entity.cache. Possible values are:
READ_WRITE
NONSTRICT_READ_WRITE
READ_ONLY
TRANSACTIONAL
NONE

a.title: Go to Cache namespace element group

td.documentation:
Defines the default strategy for associations between Entities caching. Can be overwrited with the corresponding tagged value @andromda.persistence.association.cache. Possible values are:
READ_WRITE
NONSTRICT_READ_WRITE
READ_ONLY
TRANSACTIONAL
NONE

a.title: Go to Clustering namespace element group

td.documentation:
Enable/disable EJB 3.0 clustering by the application server. Applies to stateless and stateful session bean clustering. You can override the default setting via the @andromda.service.clustered tagged value. Possible values are:
true
false

a.title: Go to Transactions namespace element group

td.documentation:
Defines the classname of a TransactionManagerLookup which is required when JVM-level caching is enabled or when using hilo generator in a JTA environment. Typicallyl, this value is:
org.hibernate.transaction.JBossTransactionManagerLookup

a.title: Go to Transactions namespace element group

td.documentation:
Define if the session will automatically be flushed during the before completion phase of the transaction. Handy options for CMT demarcation. Possible values are:
true
false

a.title: Go to Transactions namespace element group

td.documentation:
Define if the session will be automatically closed during the after completion phase of the transaction. Handy option when using CMT demarcation. Possible values are:
true
false

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing an entity name. {0} is used to represent the entity name in the model, so if you specified a value of {0}Entity all the entities generated would have a suffix of "Entity".

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the entity implementation name.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing an entity listener class name.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing an entity embeddable super class name.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing a service bean name. {0} is used to represent the service bean name in the model, so if you specified a value of {0}Bean all the entities generated would have a suffix of "Bean".

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the service bean parent interface name.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the service bean local interface name.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the service bean remote interface name.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the service bean implementation name.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the service bean listener class name.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the service bean delegate class name.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the service bean base class name.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the service test class name.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the package for the service test class.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the service test operation name.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern used to the create the implementation operation name for both session and entity bean operations. (i.e. the operations that actually perform the handling of the logic), where {0} represents the operation name.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the default service exception name. NOTE: This propety is only applicable when allowDefaultServiceExceptions is true.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when construction the JMS message driven bean class name.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constucting the JMS message driven bean listener class name.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the JMS message driven bean implementation class name.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the message driven bean test class name.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the package for the message driven bean test class.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the durable subscription ID for a MDB. Only use for topics with durable subscription.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the interceptor class name.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the composite primary key class name.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The prefix to give to the EJB JNDI names (this allows the same EJBs to be deployed multiple times in the same container)

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the manageable service base name.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the create manageable application exception name.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the read manageable application exception name.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the update manageable application exception name.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the update manageable application exception name.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when defining the display attribute label name when it's of type Collection.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when defining the display attribute label name when it's NOT of type Collection.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when defining the web service interface name when exposing session bean operations as web services.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing an embedded value implementation name.

a.title: Go to MDB Properties namespace element group

td.documentation:
The default destination type for a JMS message driven bean. Possible values are:
javax.jms.Queue
javax.jms.Topic

a.title: Go to MDB Properties namespace element group

td.documentation:
The default topic subscription durability. Possible values are:
Durable
NonDurable

a.title: Go to Entity Properties namespace element group

td.documentation:
The default view type accessability for an entity POJO bean.
Permitted values are:
local
remote
both

a.title: Go to Entity Properties namespace element group

td.documentation:
The value of the CascadeType annotation of the entity association. Possible values are:
ALL
PERSIST
MERGE
REMOVE
REFRESH
NONE if one does not exist
It is possible to comma separate multiple cascade properties.

a.title: Go to Entity Properties namespace element group

td.documentation:
Indicates how a UML composition should be interpreted to determine cascadable operations that are propogated to the associated entity.
If undefined, the cascade attribute is computed by AndroMDA. If default cascade is all , then cascade is all otherwise cascade is REMOVE .
If ths property is defined, its value is generated at each occurence of a UML composition as the inverse side is not marked with a cascade annotation element which indicates no cascade propgation.

a.title: Go to Entity Properties namespace element group

td.documentation:
Indicates how a UML aggreation should be interpreted to determine cascadable operations that are propogated to the associated entity.
If underfined, aggregation is not interpreted as a cascade value.
If the property is defined, its valie is generated at each occurence of a UML aggregation ad the inverse side is not marked with a cascade annotation element which indicates no cascade propogation.

a.title: Go to Entity Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: Default entity identifier primary key generator type set to AUTO unless specified using @andromda.persistence.column.generatorType tagged value.

a.title: Go to Entity Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: Default generator initial value used when allocating id numbers from the generator.

a.title: Go to Entity Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: Default generator amount to increment by when allocating id number from the generator.

a.title: Go to Entity Properties namespace element group

td.documentation:
Defines the entity inheritance strategy used for the entity class hierarchy (unless overridden on an entity level by the
@andromda.persistence.inheritance
tagged value, can be the following possible values:
SINGLE_TABLE - table per hierarchy.
TABLE_PER_CLASS - table per class in hierarchy.
JOINED - Table per class.

a.title: Go to Entity Properties namespace element group

td.documentation:
The value of the discriminatorType element for the Inheritance annotation of the entity. Possible values are:
STRING
CHAR
INTEGER

a.title: Go to Entity Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The DiscriminatorColumn annotation defines the discriminator column for the SINGLE_TABLE and JOINED mapping inheritance strategies. The name element defines the name of the column to be used for the discriminator. It will default to TYPE if it is required and not specified..

a.title: Go to Entity Properties namespace element group

td.documentation:
Specifies whether to include the generic finder property. Generic finders in the entity bean include findByPrimaryKey and findAll. Permitted values are:
true
false

a.title: Go to Entity Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The default column length specified for the storage of a string based enumeration literal.

a.title: Go to Entity Properties namespace element group

td.documentation:
Specifies that the persistence property should be persisted as a temporal type. This is only specified on fields of type java.util.Date or java.util.Calendar. Possible values are:
DATE
TIME
TIMESTAMP

a.title: Go to Service Properties namespace element group

td.documentation:
The default view type accessability for a session bean.
Permitted values are:
local
remote
both

a.title: Go to Service Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The name to give the service locator class.

a.title: Go to DAO Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not the DAOs should make up an inheritance tree in the same way as their respective entities. This is disabled by default but you might want to enable it if you prefer to have top-level DAO operations visible in child DAO classes. The EJB3 cartridge uses JDK5 generics, further enahanced by enabling the enableTemplating namespace property.

a.title: Go to DAO Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not the create methods on the DAOs taking properties from the entity shall be generated.

a.title: Go to DAO Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the DAO name. {0} is used to represent the entity name in the model, so if you specified a value of {0}Dao all the entities generated would have a suffix of "Dao".

a.title: Go to DAO Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the base DAO's name. {0} is used to represent the entity name in the model, so if you specified a value of {0}DaoBase all the entities generated would have a suffix of "DaoBase".

a.title: Go to DAO Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the DAO's implementation name. {0} is used to represent the entity name in the model, so if you specified a value of {0}DaoImpl all the entities generated would have a suffix of "DaoImpl".

a.title: Go to DAO Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the DAO default exception name.

a.title: Go to WebService Properties namespace element group

td.documentation:
The default style given all web services (if not defined seperately on each web service). Possible choices are:
rpc
document

a.title: Go to WebService Properties namespace element group

td.documentation:
The default use given all web services (if not defined seperately on each web service). Possible choices are:
literal
encoded

a.title: Go to WebService Properties namespace element group

td.documentation:
The default parameter encoding style for a webservice operation. Possible choices are:
wrapped
bare

a.title: Go to WebService Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when a qualified name local part is created. {0} represents the name of the classifier (Service).

a.title: Go to WebService Properties namespace element group

td.documentation:
Specifies whether to use the JSR 181 web services standards to expose web service operations in the EJB3 cartridge. If set to false, use the webservice cartridge provided by AndroMDA/Axis. Possible choices are:
true
false

a.title: Go to WebService Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when a namespace is created. {0} represents the package name of the classifier (i.e. ws.{0} would prefix all your type and service namespaces with ws.).

a.title: Go to WebService Properties namespace element group

td.documentation:
Whether or not to reverse the ordering of the namespace. The namespace is typically determined by the package name of the service or type, this allows you to reverse the package name. (i.e. org.andromda.samples would become samples.andromda.org if this was set to true). Possible value are:
true
false

a.title: Go to WebService Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The context root for the web service.

a.title: Go to WebService Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The URL pattern appended to the context root for the web service.

a.title: Go to Security Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: Specifies the security domain to use for role based authorization. Use the security realm to match allowed roles. This is only applicable for session beans and MDBs.

a.title: Go to Security Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: A comma separated list of roles added to the DAO base RolesAllowed annotation. This requires securityRealm be enabled. This exists because in some cases it is incorrect to model an actor dependency on the manageable entity and expect that actor to define the authorised role on ManageableServiceBeans. This property separates the roles for manageable session beans and the remaining components. It is expected that the list of roles secure all manageable session beans.

a.title: Go to Other Properties namespace element group

td.documentation:
Determines whether the default persistence provider extensions such as annotations should also be rendered. By default, this is disabled. To enable caching: this must be set to hibernate such that the Hibernate caching annotations are rendered. To enable JBoss Seam: this must be set to hibernate such that the hibernate validator annotations are rendered. To enable Hiberate Criteria Query, this must be set to hibernate. Possible values are:
none
hibernate

a.title: Go to Other Properties namespace element group

td.documentation:
The default persistence container engine name. Used when specifying specific annotations for different persistence containers. Possible values are:
jboss
weblogic

a.title: Go to Other Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: Specifies the default persistence context unit name associated with the default Entity Manager.

a.title: Go to Other Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The implementation type to use for association ends that are modeled as lists.

a.title: Go to Other Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The implementation type to use for association ends that are modeled as sets.

a.title: Go to Other Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The implementation type to use for association ends that are modeled as maps.

a.title: Go to Other Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: A flag indicating whether or not specific collection interfaces will be used in association end mutators and accessors (i.e. java.util.Set, java.util.List, etc). If this is set to false, then the value of the defaultCollectionInterface property will used to provide the collection interface.

a.title: Go to Other Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The default collection interface, this is the interface used with association end accessors and mutators if the specificCollectionInterfaces flag is set to false.

a.title: Go to Other Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: Used to define the default mapping for EJB3 collections.

a.title: Go to Other Properties namespace element group
Go to Other Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The default association end collection index type (this can be overridden by the @andromda.persistence.collection.index.type (this is applicable when the collection is a map).

a.title: Go to Other Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: URI specifying the specific mappings from model types to ejb3/hibernate types. (i.e. file:${basedir}/HibernateTypeMappings.xml). This is not necessary but useful for defining hibernate user types (when hibernate doesn't support a specific type in the manner needed for your application).

a.title: Go to Other Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: Allows you to turn on/off whether or not composite associations will define eager loading and aggregate associations define lazy loading.

a.title: Go to Other Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not named parameters (i.e. ':someParameter') or unnamed (i.e. '?') parameters should be used in the SQL queries embedded within the model. NOTE: Does not apply to queries written in OCL.

a.title: Go to Other Properties namespace element group
Go to Other Properties namespace element group
Go to Other Properties namespace element group

td.documentation:
The default value to use for transaction types.
Permitted values are:
NOT_SUPPORTED
SUPPORTS
REQUIRED
REQUIRES_NEW
MANDATORY
NEVER
NOTE: Can be overridden on a per bean/bean operation basis with the
@andromda.ejb.transaction.type
tagged value.

a.title: Go to Other Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The package to which extra types are generated (i.e. ServiceLocator).

a.title: Go to Other Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not parameters should be checked if they're required on services bean operation.

a.title: Go to Other Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The encoding for xml documents

a.title: Go to Other Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not to generate a default exception for each service. This exception will handle unexpected exceptions occuring within the implemented operations.

a.title: Go to Other Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: The name to give the CRUD manageable service locator class.

a.title: Go to Other Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: Set to true to enable the JBoss Seam application framework for Java EE 5.

a.title: Go to Other Properties namespace element group

td.documentation: A list of one or more fully qualified java types that should be ignored whenever a type conversion needs to be done. Currently, there is an issue with ValueObjects generated with the Java Axis mappings that causes the relevant cartidge to generate DAO "entity to value object" type conversions incorrectly for all date types. By listing those date types here, the relevant cartridge will not attempt to auto-generate conversions for date/time related attributes.
